hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{356}$ |  $\maroonD3$ | $\maroonD5$ | $\maroonD6$
$\blueE{529}$ | $\blueE5$ | $\blueE2$ | $\blueE9$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{356}=\maroonD{3\text{ hundreds}} + \maroonD{5\text{ tens}} + \maroonD{6\text{ ones}}$.  
$\blueE{529}= \blueE{5\text{ hundreds}} + \blueE{2\text{ tens}} + \blueE{9\text { ones}}$.
$3\text{ hundreds} + 5\text{ hundreds} + 5 \text{ tens}+2\text{ tens} +6 \text{ ones}+9 \text{ ones}$ is the same as $356 + 529$.

question.content:
**Which of the following is equal to $356+529$?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: $\small 3\text{ hundreds} + 5\text{ hundreds} + 5 \text{ tens}+2\text{ tens} +6 \text{ ones}+9 \text{ ones}$
$\small 3\text{ hundreds} + 5\text{ hundreds} + 6 \text{ tens}+5\text{ tens} +2 \text{ ones}+9 \text{ ones}$
$\small 3\text{ hundreds} + 5\text{ hundreds} + 5 \text{ ones}+2\text{ ones} +6 \text{ tens}+9 \text{ tens}$
